result.execSummary:
The defendant Virgil H Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Virgil H Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Virgil H Smith was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and follow through with any counseling or treatment deemed appropriate by agent. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Mental Health Evaluation.

No abusive contact with the Victim.
Maintain full time employment and or schooling.
Financial obligations to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts by 7-5-22, or payment arrangements to be made with Clerk's Office.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is public defender eligible. Defendant has other cases with an Attorney and has been advised to contact public defender for this case. Counsel to schedule for further hearings with the judicial assistant. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court sets $500.00 cash bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety. Court sets adjourned initial appearance for March 7th at 9:15am to allow time for counsel and to receive the complaint.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.
